shared.facades

Class TradingFacade

  • java.lang.Object
    • shared.facades.AbstractFacade
      • shared.facades.TradingFacade

  • public class TradingFacade
extends AbstractFacade
    Provides common operations for users to trade with each other.

    • Method Detail

      • canOfferTrade

        public boolean canOfferTrade(@NotNull
                             Player sender,
                             @NotNull
                             Player receiver,
                             @NotNull
                             ResourceSet offer)
        Returns whether a player can trade with another player with the given conditions.

        These are the conditions to be met:

        • sender and receiver must be in the same game.
        • It must be sender's turn.
        • The game must be in a state in which trading is allowed.
        • The offer must add and subtract at least one resource.
        • The sender can afford to send the given resources
        Parameters:
        sender - the sender of the trade, not null
        receiver - the receiver of the trade, not null
        offer - the offer to make - what sender gets (+) and receives (-)
        Returns:
        true if all of the conditions are met; otherwise false
        See Also:
        canOfferTrade(Player, Player)
        Precondition:
        None of the parameters are null.

      • canOfferTrade

        public boolean canOfferTrade(@NotNull
                             Player sender,
                             @Nullable
                             Player receiver)
        Returns whether a player can trade with another player at all.

        These are the conditions to be met:

        • sender and receiver must be in the same game.
        • It must be sender's turn.
        • The game must be in a state in which trading is allowed.
        Parameters:
        sender - the sender of the trade, not null
        receiver - the receiver of the trade, or null if none
        Returns:
        true if all of the conditions are met; otherwise false
        See Also:
        canOfferTrade(Player, Player, ResourceSet)
        Precondition:
        None of the parameters are null.

      • offerTrade

        public void offerTrade(@NotNull
                       Player sender,
                       @NotNull
                       Player receiver,
                       @NotNull
                       ResourceSet offer)
        Offer to trade with another player with the given conditions.
        Parameters:
        sender - the sender of the trade, not null
        receiver - the receiver of the trade, not null
        offer - the offer to make - what sender gets (+) and receives (-)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the precondition is violated
        See Also:
        canOfferTrade(Player, Player, ResourceSet), IServer.offerTrade(OfferTradeAction)
        Precondition:
        canOfferTrade(Player, Player, ResourceSet) returns true
        Postcondition:
        A pending trade offer will be pending for the sender and receiver.

public TradeOffer getMadeTradeOffer(@NotNull
                                              Player sender)
        Detect if a player has made any outstanding trade offers waiting to be accepted by someone else.
        Parameters:
        sender - the person who has made the trade offer
        Returns:
        the trade offers made by the player, or null if none

      • getWaitingTradeOffer

        @Nullable
public TradeOffer getWaitingTradeOffer(@NotNull
                                                 Player receiver)
        Detect if a player has any outstanding trade offers waiting to be accepted/rejected by them.
        Parameters:
        receiver - the player to check if they have any trade offers waiting for them
        Returns:
        the trade offers waiting for a response from the player, or null if none

      • respondToTradeOffer

        public void respondToTradeOffer(@NotNull
                                Player receiver,
                                boolean willAccept)
        Respond to a trade offer that is withstanding with receiver as the receiver of the trade.
        Parameters:
        receiver - the player that is receiving the trade
        willAccept - whether the player will accept the trade desired

      • maritimeTradeRatio

        public int maritimeTradeRatio(@NotNull
                              Player player,
                              @NotNull
                              ResourceType giveType)
        Get the best maritime trade ratio available to a player.

        For example, a trade ratio of 3 for ore means that the player can trade 3 ore for any resource card.

        Depending on the player's harbor configuration, this returns 2-4.

        Parameters:
        player - the player to check for, not null
        giveType - the type of resource to check, not null
        Returns:
        the best trade ratio available to the player for the given resource type, 2-4

      • canMaritimeTrade

        public boolean canMaritimeTrade(@NotNull
                                Player player)
        Determines whether a player can perform any maritime trade at all.

        It must be the player's turn.

        Parameters:
        player - the player that wants to perform the trade, not null
        Returns:
        true if the player can maritime trade with these conditions; false otherwise

      • maritimeSendOptions

        public ResourceType[] maritimeSendOptions(@NotNull
                                          Player player,
                                          @Nullable
                                          ResourceType getType)
        Determines which resources a player could theoretically send to the bank in a maritime trade.

        Basically, it's every resource in the player's hand that is at least the trade ratio.

        Parameters:
        player - the player that wants to perform the trade, not null
        getType - the type of resource the player is receiving, or null if none chosen
        Returns:
        the types of resources that could theoretically be received by the player

      • maritimeReceiveOptions

        public ResourceType[] maritimeReceiveOptions(@NotNull
                                             Player player,
                                             @Nullable
                                             ResourceType giveType)
        Determines which resources a player could theoretically receive from the bank in a maritime trade.

        Basically, it's every resource from the bank that's not run out.

        Parameters:
        player - the player that wants to perform the trade, not null
        giveType - the type of resource the player is giving, or null if none chosen
        Returns:
        the types of resources that could theoretically be received by the player

      • canMaritimeTrade

        public boolean canMaritimeTrade(@NotNull
                                Player player,
                                @NotNull
                                ResourceType giveType,
                                @NotNull
                                ResourceType getType)
        Determines whether a player can perform a maritime trade with the given resource.

        It must be the player's turn.

        Parameters:
        player - the player that wants to perform the trade, not null
        giveType - the type of resource to trade with, not null
        getType - the type of resource to trade for, not null
        Returns:
        true if the player can maritime trade with these conditions; false otherwise
        Precondition:
        ratio is equal to the value returned by maritimeTradeRatio(shared.models.game.Player, shared.definitions.ResourceType)
        Postcondition:
        None.

      • maritimeTrade

        public void maritimeTrade(@NotNull
                          Player player,
                          @NotNull
                          ResourceType giveType,
                          @NotNull
                          ResourceType getType)
        Performs a maritime trade with the given resource and ratio.

        It must be the player's turn, and at the ratio desired must be valid.

        Parameters:
        player - the player that wants to perform the trade, not null
        giveType - the type of resource to trade with, not null
        getType - the type of resource to trade for, not null
        Precondition:
        canMaritimeTrade(shared.models.game.Player) returns true.
        Postcondition:
        the user trades ratio of the resourceType for 1
